metadata.title: CVE-2018-19052 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in mod_alias_physical_handler in mod_alias.c inlighttpd before 1.4.50. There is potential ../ path traversal of a singledirectory above an alias target, with a specific mod_alias configurationwhere the matched alias lacks a trailing '/' character, but the aliastarget filesystem path does have a trailing '/' character.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-mysql-vhost - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1').
